locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the discrepancy between Easter attendance and 'Low Sunday', interpreting the post-resurrection appearances of Jesus as selective acts of God for chosen witnesses.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Focuses on the 'not to all the people' aspect of Acts 10, linking it to the nature of the risen body and the necessity of the Cross.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from describing the biblical narrative to addressing the congregation as the current 'chosen witnesses'.
voorbeelden: I invite you to take it seriously.
In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To transform the hearer's identity from a 'pew-sitter' to a 'chosen witness' empowered by the Spirit.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: High. Explicitly mentions the Spirit as the 'engine' and 'fuel' of faith.

voorbeelden: God raised him on the third day.
The Resurrection of Jesus was not a proof.
It's always hard to see the falling-off.
Do not go out from here with a furrowed brow.
It is a special joy to see each and every one of you.
He will show you what he has for you.
He has already prepared good works for you.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. The promises are present but often framed as future possibilities rather than immediate certainties.

voorbeelden: God has made him manifest to you.
He is here with us at this moment.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the office to declare the congregation's status as 'chosen'.

indicatoren: Extensive historical retelling of the Acts narrative.
Theological explanation of why people don't return after Easter.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged but remains an observer for much of the sermon.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of being 'talked about' as a witness rather than being 'made' a witness in the moment.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong personal address toward the end.
voorbeelden: God has chosen you for something more.
The Holy Spirit will be in your words.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to confer the status of 'witness'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the disciples, the crowds, and theological concepts.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a historical buffer before the application.

actueel_present.gebruik: Addressing the congregation in the pews now.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the indicative of the Resurrection to the declarative 'God has chosen you'.
voorbeelden: God raised Jesus (Assertive) -> God has chosen you (Declarative) -> Tell your children (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Good, though the transition happens late in the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because you ate and drank with the Lord... tell your children.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to reassure the 'faithful remnant' of their identity, using the biblical text to validate their presence on a 'Low Sunday'.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: You are those who 'ate and drank with him'.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long story about the wheelchair.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Shifts focus from the Word to the preacher's experience.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops explaining the text and starts commissioning the people.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strong on the 'Toezegging' (Promise), but slightly heavy on the 'talking about' the Spirit rather than the Spirit speaking through the Word.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly claimed in the 'Get over it' and healing sections.
tekstueel_bewijs: I suggest to you that you think of this as good news.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, 'it is not up to me'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit will be in your words.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, linked to the 'eating and drinking'.
tekstueel_bewijs: He is here with us at this moment.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: High frequency of past-tense assertives. Needs more present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Resurrection of Jesus was not a proof given by God.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God does not offer you a proof; He offers you His Risen Son.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a definition to an encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The toezegging is already the strongest part.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Bring the toezegging earlier into the exegesis.
voorbeeldzinnen: As Peter spoke to them then, Christ speaks to you now.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'they' in the first half.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to bridge the gap between the biblical 'witnesses' and the congregation sooner.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones God has manifested Himself to.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the imperative 'Tell them' grounded in the indicative 'He is here'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply pastoral sermon that successfully uses SAT to move from 'Low Sunday' observations to 'High Sunday' commissioning.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's feelings of inadequacy, SAT focuses on the objective power of the 'Name of Jesus' to effect change.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the 'storytelling' of the healing, but in the 'Name' as a performative tool.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's climax is not the anecdote, but the declarative act of calling the congregation 'witnesses'.

appendices.notities: The preacher's use of 'I' is pastoral but risks becoming the locutionary center instead of the Word.
